chargeHist.descr: 1st Degree Child Sexual Assault - Intercourse with Person under 12
Repeated Sexual Assault of Same Child (At Least 3 Violations of 1st Degree Sexual Assault)

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: 1st Degree Child Sexual Assault - Intercourse with Person under 12
Repeated Sexual Assault of Same Child (At Least 3 Violations of 1st Degree Sexual Assault)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Hussein Bin Shekandar

records.addlTxt: Scheduling Conference held.  Defense advises she has received discovery and an offer.  Defense requests a final pretrial and jury trial.  Court advises the parties any motions are due by November 1, 2022.

Defendant Hussein Bin Shekandar in court, in custody.  Attorney Lori Ann Kuehn in court for Hussein Bin Shekandar.  Attorney Ken Olstinski for Jessica Bellows in court for State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm 
Sworn as interpreter:  Simon Koko (Burmese)
Final pre-trial scheduled for December 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial scheduled for January 3, 2023 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Hussein Bin Shekandar in court with Attorney Lori Ann Kuehn.  Defendant Hussein Bin Shekandar in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Sworn as interpreter: Khinma Uddin. PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Detective J. Del Moral. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 12.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 24, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Hussein Bin Shekandar in court by video with Attorney Lori Ann Kuehn who appears in person.  Edward OBrien appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. The defendant needs an interpreter; one is not scheduled for todays proceedings. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Hussein Bin Shekandar not in court, defendant in custody.  Adam Joseph Best appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a preliminary hearing. SPD has not appinted counsel. State requests the matter be sent to the trial court for a State V. Lee hearing. Request is denied.  Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no contact with NBS, MBS, HY
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  If electronic monitoring device is unavailable and cash bail has been paid, Defendant to be released and placed on the waiting list.
Sworn as Burmese interpreter: Koko, Simon

Defendant Hussein Bin Shekandar in court with attorney Helmi Hamad.  Defendant Hussein Bin Shekandar in custody.  John J Rejowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Hussein Bin Shekandar appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Borowski, Branch 12.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a Preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.   DEFENDANT QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Commissioner advised if DNA sample has NOT been obtained from the Defendant Court orders the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department to obtain DNA sample from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).   This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
